gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 mIxw mUMh kwlw
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: qIrQ mMiJ invwsu hY bgulw ApqIxw
transliteration: Teerad Manjhi Nivaasu Hai Bagulaa Apateenaa.
translation: Crane though living at a pilgrimage centre remains without faith.

gurmukhi: lvY bbIhw vrsdY jl jwie n pIxw
transliteration: Lavai Babeehaa Varasadai Jal Jaai N Peenaa.
translation: The rain-bird goes on crying during rain but dries not know how to drink water.

gurmukhi: vwNs sugMiD n hoveI prml sMig lIxw
transliteration: Vaansu Sougandhi N Hovaee Paramal Sangi Leenaa.
translation: Bamboo may be engrossed in sandalwood but cannot take its fragrance.

gurmukhi: GuGU suJu n suJeI krmw dw hIxw
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Karamaa Daa Heenaa.
translation: So unfortunate is owl that it never beholds sun.

gurmukhi: nwiB kQUrI imrg dy vqY EfIxw
transliteration: Naabhi Kadooree Mirag Day Vatai Aodeenaa.
translation: Though musk remains in the el of deer, yet it goes on running around in search of it.

gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwiqswhu muhu kwlY mIxw ]1]
transliteration: Satigur Sachaa Paatasiaahu Muhu Kaalai Meenaa ?1?
translation: The true Guru is true emperor and the faces of the dissemblers are blackened.

gurmukhi: 2 mIxy dw rwj JUTw
translation: Pretentious of dissembler are exposed

gurmukhi: nIlwrI dy mt ivic pY igdVu rqw
transliteration: Neelaaree Day Mat Vichi Pai Gidarhu Rataa.
translation: Once a jackal fell into a dyer's vat and got dyed.

gurmukhi: jMgl AMdir jwie kY pwKMfu kmqw
transliteration: Jangal Andari Jaai Kai Paakhandu Kamataa.
translation: Taking advantage of its changed colour, it went into the jungle and started dissembling (the animals there).

gurmukhi: dir syvY imrgwvlI hoie bhY Avqw
transliteration: Dari Sayvai Miragaavalee Hoi Bahai Avataa.
translation: Sitting arrogantly in its lair, it would frighten the deer into serving it.

gurmukhi: krY hkUmiq AglI kUVY mid mqw
transliteration: Karai Hakoomati Agalee Koorhai Madi Mataa.
translation: Intoxicated by false pride it started ruling (over the animals) with great pomp.

gurmukhi: bolix pwj auGwiVAw ijau mUlI pqw
transliteration: Bolani Paaj Oughaarhiaa Jiu Moolee Pataa.
translation: As eructation indicates the eating of radish leaf, it also got exposed when it (having listened to the howls of other jackals) also started howling.

gurmukhi: iqau drgih mIxw mwrIAY kir kUVu kupqw ]2]
transliteration: Tiu Daragahi Meenaa Maareeai Kari Koorhu Koupataa ?2?
translation: Thus, the dissembler out of his own hypocrisis is beaten hollow in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: 3 mIxw-s`cI sMgq nhIN bxw skdw
translation: A dissembler cannot create a holy congregation-

gurmukhi: coru krY inq corIAwN EVik duK BwrI
transliteration: Choru Karai Nit Choreeaan Aorhaki Doukh Bhaaree.
translation: A thief commits thefts daily but ultimnately has to suffer heavily.

gurmukhi: nku kMnu PiV vFIAY rwvY prnwrI
transliteration: Naku Kannu Dharhi Vaddheeai Raavai Par Naaree.
translation: The ears and nose are chopped of the man who ravishes an other's wife.

gurmukhi: AauGt ruDy imrg ijau ivqu hwir jUAwrI
transliteration: Aoughat Rudhay Mirag Jiu Vitu Haari Jooaaree.
translation: The position of the losing gambler is similar to the deer caught in a trap.

gurmukhi: lM|I kuhil n AwveI pr vyil ipAwrI
transliteration: Lee Kuhali N Aavaee Par Vayli Piaaree.
translation: A lame woman may not move properly, but being other's wife she looks lovable.

gurmukhi: vg n hovin kuqIAw mIxy murdwrI
transliteration: Vag N Hovani Kouteeaa Meenay Muradaaree.
translation: Bitches not being there in droves the dissemblers eat the carrion.

gurmukhi: pwphu mUil n qgIAY hoie AMiq KuAwrI ]3]
transliteration: Paapahu Mooli N Tageeai Hoi Anti Khuaaree ?3?
translation: Through evil actions liberation can never be attained and ultimately one becomes wretched.

gurmukhi: 4 mIxw-jmpur jwvygw
translation: Dissembler will ultimately go to the hell-

gurmukhi: cwnix cMd n pujeI cmkY twnwxw
transliteration: Chaanani Chand N Pujaee Chamakai Taanaanaa.
translation: The glow-worm may glow as much as it likes but its shine cannot reach the brightness of moon.

gurmukhi: swier bUMd brwbrI ikau AwiK vKwxw
transliteration: Saair Boond Baraabaree Kiu Aakhi Vakhaanaa.
translation: How it could be said that the ocean and a drop of water are equal.

gurmukhi: kIVI ieB n ApVY kUVw iqsu mwxw
transliteration: Keerhee Ibh N Aparhai Koorhaa Tisu Maanaa.
translation: An ant can never equal an elephant; its pride is false.

gurmukhi: nwnyhwlu vKwxdw mw pwis ieAwxw
transliteration: Naanayhaalu Vakhaanadaa Maa Paasi Iaanaa.
translation: A child's describing his maternal grand father's house to his mother is futile.

gurmukhi: ijin qUM swij invwijAw dy ipMfu prwxw
transliteration: Jini Toon Saaji Nivaajiaa Day Pind Puraanaa.
translation: 0 dissembler ! if you have totallly forgotten that Lord who has bestowed body

gurmukhi: muFhu GuQhu mIixAw quDu jmpuir jwxw ]4]
transliteration: Muddhahu Ghudahu Meeniaa Tudhu Jam Puri Jaanaa ?4?
translation: And soul upon you, you will go straight to the abode of Yama

gurmukhi: 5 mIxy dI sMgq KotI qy duKdweI hY
translation: Association with the dissembler is bad as well as painful

gurmukhi: kYhw idsY aujlw msu AMdir icqY
transliteration: Kaihaa Disai Ujalaa Masu Andari Chitai.
translation: The bronze appears bright but inside it remains blackness .

gurmukhi: hirAw iqlu bUAwV ijau Plu kMmu n ikqY
transliteration: Hariaa Tilu Booaarh Jiu Phalu Kanm N Kitai.
translation: Baal: weed plant in a field of sesame may be lush green but it. fruit is worthless.

gurmukhi: jyhI klI knyr dI min qin duhu iBqY
transliteration: Jayhee Kalee Kanayr Dee Mani Tani Duhu Bhitai.
translation: The oleander bud has two aspects; externally it is beautiful but internally it is poisonous.

gurmukhi: pyNJU idsin rMguly mrIAY AgilqY
transliteration: Payndoo Disani Rangulay Mareeai Agalitai.
translation: Pelijha, the ripe fruit of wild caper looks colourful but over eating it man dies instantly.

gurmukhi: KrI suAwilE vysuAw jIA bJw ieqY
transliteration: Kharee Suaaliao Vaysuaa Jeea Bajhaa Itai.
translation: Prostitute looks very beautiful but she ensnares the mind (and ultimately man stands finished).

gurmukhi: KotI sMgiq mIixAw duK dyNdI imqY ]5]
transliteration: Khotee Sangati Meeniaa Doukh Dayndee Mitai ?5?
translation: Similarly, dissembler's company causes suffering for their friends

gurmukhi: 6 mIxw- nkt pMQ nrk iljwNdw hY
translation: The way of dissembler leads to hell-

gurmukhi: biDku nwdu suxwiekY ijau imrgu ivxwhY
transliteration: Badhiku Naadu Sounaai Kai Jiu Miragu Vinaahai.
translation: As a hunter inveigles the deer with music and entraps it;

gurmukhi: JIvru kuMfI mwsu lwie ijau mCI PwhY
transliteration: Jheevaru Koundee Maasu Laai Jiu Machhee Dhaahai.
translation: As the fisherman putting meat on hook catches hold of the fish;

gurmukhi: kvlu idKwlY muhu iKVwie BvrY vyswhY
transliteration: Kavalu Dikhaalai Muhu Khirhaai Bhavarai Vaysaahai.
translation: As the lotus showing its blossommed face beguiles the black-bee;

gurmukhi: dIpk joiq pqMg no durjn ijau dwhY
transliteration: Deepak Joti Patang No Durajan Jiu Daahai.
translation: As the flame of lamp burns moth like an enemy;

gurmukhi: kwlbUq hoie hsqnI mYglu EmwhY
transliteration: Kalaa Roop Hoi Hasatanee Maigalu Aomaahai.
translation: As the paper-model of a female elephant makes the male counterpart erotomaniac;

gurmukhi: iqau nkt pMQu hY mIixAw imil nrik inbwhY ]6]
transliteration: Tiu Nakat Pandu Hai Meeniaa Mili Naraki Nibaahai ?6?
translation: Similarly the way of brazen-faced dissemblers leads towards hell.

gurmukhi: 7 mIxw- sMgq inrws krdI hY
translation: Dissembler's association disappoints-

gurmukhi: hir cMdaurI dyiK kY krdy Brvwsw
transliteration: Hari Chandauree Daykhi Kai Karaday Bharavaasaa.
translation: How can mirage in desert quench the thirst?

gurmukhi: Ql ivic qpn BTIAw ikau lhY ipAwsw
transliteration: Dal Vich Tapani Bhatdeeaa Kiu Lahai Piaasaa.
translation: People, in dreams enjoy by becoming kings (but in the morning they possess nothing).

gurmukhi: suhxy rwju kmweIAY kir Bog iblwsw
transliteration: Suhanay Raaju Kamaaeeai Kari Bhog Bilaasaa.
translation: How can one hope that the shade of a tree would remain stationary?

gurmukhi: CwieAw ibrKu n rhY iQru pujY ikau Awsw
transliteration: Chhaaiaa Birakhu N Rahai Diru Pujai Kiu Aasaa.
translation: All this is a fake show like that of an acrobat's.

gurmukhi: bwjIgr dI Kyf ijau sBu kUVu qmwsw
transliteration: Baajeegar Dee Khayd Jiu Sabhu Koorhu Tamaasaa.
translation: One who keeps association with dissemblers,

gurmukhi: rlY ju sMgiq mIixAw auiT clY inrwsw ]7]
transliteration: Ralai Ju Sangati Meeniaa Outdi Chalai Niraasaa ?7?
translation: Ultimately goes (from this world) disapponited.

gurmukhi: 8 mIxy pIr iPtky hn
translation: Dissemblers are accurst by the Guru

gurmukhi: koiel kwNau rlweIAin ikau hovin iekY
transliteration: Koil Kaanu Ralaaeeani Kiu Hovani Ikai.
translation: Crows and cuckoos however mixed, cannot be one.

gurmukhi: iqau inMdk jg jwxIAin boil bolix iPkY
transliteration: Tiu Nidak Jag Jaaneeani Boli Bolani Dhikai.
translation: Likewise the slanderers are distinguished in the world by their cheap and low talk.

gurmukhi: bguly hMsu brwbrI ikau imkin imkY
transliteration: Bagulay Hansu Baraabaree Kiu Mikani Mikai.
translation: How can a crane and a swan be equated by the same measurement?

gurmukhi: iqau bymuK cuix kFIAin muih kwly itkY
transliteration: Tiu Baymoukh Chouni Kaddheeani Muhi Kaalay Tikai.
translation: Similarly the apostates are picked up, separated and stigmatized.

gurmukhi: ikAw nIswxI mIixAw Kotu swlI iskY
transliteration: Kiaa Neesaanee Meeniaa Khotu Saalee Sikai.
translation: What is the hall mark of dissemblers? They are like counter-feit coins of a fake mint.

gurmukhi: isir isir pwhxI mwrIAin Eie pIr iPitkY ]8]
transliteration: Siri Siri Paahanee Maareeani Aoi Peer Dhitikai ?8?
translation: Shoe beating is given on their heads and they are cursed by the preceptor.

gurmukhi: 9 gurU hIn ho gurU sdwauxw
translation: Being without Guru but getting called the Guru

gurmukhi: rwqI nINgr Kyldy sB hoie iekTy
transliteration: Raatee Neengar Khayladay Sabh Hoi Ikatday.
translation: Children play getting together in the evening.

gurmukhi: rwjw prjw hovdy kir swNg aupTy
transliteration: Raajaa Parajaa Hovaday Kari Saang Oupatday.
translation: Someone disguised as King and the rest as subjects, they enact ridiculous scenes.

gurmukhi: ieik lskr lY Dwvdy ieik iPrdy nTy
transliteration: Iki Lasakar Lai Dhaavaday Iki Dhiraday Natday.
translation: Some of them leading the army rush from place to place and some getting defeated flee helter-skelter.

gurmukhi: TIkrIAwN hwly Brin auie Kry AsTy
transliteration: Tdeekareeaan Haalay Bharani Ui Kharay Asatday.
translation: They pay tax by offering potshreds and thus become wise.

gurmukhi: iKn ivic Kyf aujwiVdy Gru Gru nUM qRTy
transliteration: Khin Vichi Khayd Ujaarhiday Gharu Gharu Noon Tratday.
translation: Within few moments they ruin their game and run for their homes.

gurmukhi: ivxu guxu gurU sdwiedy Eie Koty mTy ]9]
transliteration: Vinu Gounu Guroo Sadaaiday Aoi Khotay Matday ?9?
translation: Those who without merit call themselves Guru, are sluggish dissemblers.

gurmukhi: 10 gurU hIxy dy cyly inrws jwNdy hn
translation: Disciples of the persons without Guru get disappointed

gurmukhi: aucw lMmw JMtulw ivic bwg idsMdw
transliteration: Ouchaa Lamaa Jhaatulaa Vichi Baag Disandaa.
translation: Tall, high and luxuriant, the silk cotton tree is seen in the garden.

gurmukhi: motw muFu pqwil jiV bhu grb krMdw
transliteration: Motaa Muddhu Pataali Jarhi Bahu Garab Karandaa.
translation: It is proud of its stout trunk and deep roots.

gurmukhi: pq supqr sohxy ivsQwru bxMdw
transliteration: Pat Soupatar Sohanay Visadaaru Banandaa.
translation: Its beautiful green leaves enhance its spread.

gurmukhi: Pul rqy Pl bkbky hoie APl PlMdw
transliteration: Phul Ratay Phal Bakabakay Hoi Aphal Phaladaa.
translation: But because of its red flowers and insipid fruit it fructifies in vain.

gurmukhi: swvw qoqw cuhcuhw iqsu dyiK BulMdw
transliteration: Saavaa Totaa Chuhachuhaa Tisu Daykhi Bhuladaa.
translation: Seeing it, the chirping green parrot gets deluded

gurmukhi: ipCo dy pCuqwiedw Ehu Plu n lhMdw ]10]
transliteration: Pichho Day Pachhoutaaidaa Aohu Phalu N Lahandaa ?10?
translation: But repents afterwards because it gets no fruit on that tree.

gurmukhi: 11 gurU hIx hIjVw hY
translation: Impotent are they who have no Guru

gurmukhi: pihny pMjy kpVy purswvwN vysu
transliteration: Pahilai Panjay Kaparhay Purasaavaan Vaysu.
translation: Wearing five garments one may assume the garb of a male person.

gurmukhi: muCw dwVHI sohxI bhu durbl vysu
transliteration: Mouchhaan Daarhhee Sohanee Bahu Durabal Vaysu.
translation: He may have beautiful beard and moustaches and a slim body.

gurmukhi: sY hiQAwrI sUrmw pMcIN prvysu
transliteration: Sai Hadiaaree Sooramaa Pancheen Paravaysu.
translation: Wielder of a hundred weapons he may be counted among prominent knights.

gurmukhi: mwhru dV dIbwx ivic jwxY sBu dysu
transliteration: Maaharu Darh Deebaan Vichi Jaanai Sabhu Daysu.
translation: He may be an adept courtier and widely known throughout the country.

gurmukhi: purKu n gix purKqu ivxu kwmix ik krysu
transliteration: Purakhu N Gani Purakhatu Vinu Kaamani Ki Karaysu.
translation: But without masculinity, of what use is he to a woman?

gurmukhi: ivx gux gurU sdwiedy kaux krY Adysu ]11]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Guroo Sadaaiday Kaoun Karai Adaysu ?11?
translation: Who would bow before those who are without merit and get themselves called Guru

gurmukhi: 12 Shu syvw kr imldw hY
translation: Beloved is attained through service

gurmukhi: glI jy shu pweIAY qoqw ikau PwsY
transliteration: Galeen Jay Sahu Paaeeai Totaa Kiu Dhaasai.
translation: If mere chatter could help meet the beloved, why should a parrot remain encaged?

gurmukhi: imlY nw bhuq isAwxpY kwau gUMhu igrwsY
transliteration: Milai N Bahoutu Siaanapai Kaau Goonhu Giraasai.
translation: He is not attained by over-cleverness and the clever crow ultimately eats faeces.

gurmukhi: jorwvrI nw ijpeI sIh shw ivxwsY
transliteration: Joraavaree N Jipaee Seeh Sahaa Vinaasai.
translation: The power also does not win (the intellect wins) because an hare caused a lion killed (by showing its reflection and making it jump into the well).

gurmukhi: gIq kivqu n iBjeI Bt ByK audwsY
transliteration: Geet Kavitu N Bhijaee Bhat Bhaykh Udaasai.
translation: The beloved is not lured by lyrics and poems, otherwise why should minstrels adopt the garb of sannyasis.

gurmukhi: jobn rUpu nw mohIAY rMgu kusuMB durwsY
transliteration: Joban Roopu N Moheeai Rangu Kousounbh Duraasai.
translation: He is not attracted by youth and beauty because the colour of safflower is not permanent.

gurmukhi: ivxu syvw dohwgxI ipru imlY n hwsY ]12]
transliteration: Vinu Sayvaa Dohaaganee Piru Milai N Haasai ?12?
translation: Without service (to the Lord and His creation) this soul is deserted woman and the beloved is not attained merely by laughing (foolishly). He is attained through service.

gurmukhi: 13 mukqI dy Awpxy swDn inSPl
translation: All the means for liberation are useless

gurmukhi: isr qlvwieAwN pweIAY cmigdV jUhy
transliteration: Sir Talavaaay Paaeeai Chamagidarh Joohai.
translation: If bowing only could grant liberation then the bats in the forests hang from trees upside down.

gurmukhi: mVI mswxI jy imlY ivc KufwN cUhy
transliteration: Marhee Masaanee Jay Milai Vichi Khudaan Choohai.
translation: If liberation were achieved in the loneliness of crematories then rats should get it in their holes.

gurmukhi: imly n vfI Awrjw ibsIAru ivhu lUhy
transliteration: Milai N Vadee Aarajaa Biseearu Vihu Loohai.
translation: Longevity also does not bring it because snake during its whole long life goes on smouldering in its own poison.

gurmukhi: hoie kucIlu vrqIAY Kr sUr BsUhy
transliteration: Hoi Koucheelu Varateeai Khar Soor Bhasoohay.
translation: If dirt could make it attainable, asses and swines always remain dirty and muddy.

gurmukhi: kMd mUl icqu lweIAY AeIAV vxu DUhy
transliteration: Kand Mool Laaeeai Aeearh Vanu Dhoohay.
translation: If relishing over tubers and roots could provide it (liberation), then herd of animals go on hauling and eating them (they should also have attained liberation).

gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq nw hoveI ijau Gru ivxu bUhy ]13]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Jioun Gharu Vinu Boohay ?13?
translation: As a house (in fact) is useless without door, one cannot attain liberation without Guru.

gurmukhi: 14 qpwN hyTwN ByKwN nwl mukiq nhIN
translation: No liberation through auterities, guises and asceticism

gurmukhi: imlY ij qIriQ nwiqAwN ffwN jl vwsI
transliteration: Milai Ji Teeradi Naatiaan Dadaan Jal Vaasee.
translation: If one could attain liberation by taking bath at pilgrimage centres then (we know that) the frogs always live in water.

gurmukhi: vwl vDwieAwN pweIAY bV jtwN plwsI
transliteration: Vaal Vadhaaiaan Paaeeai Barh Jataan Palaasee.
translation: If growing long hair could make it available then the banyan has long roots hanging from it.

gurmukhi: nMgy rihAwN jy imlY vix imrg audwsI
transliteration: Nagay Rahiaan Jay Milai Vani Mirag Udaasee.
translation: If going naked gets it, all the deer in the forest can be called detached ones.

gurmukhi: Bsm lwie jy pweIAY Kru Kyh invwsI
transliteration: Bhasam Laai Jay Paaeeai Kharu Khayh Nivaasee.
translation: If it is attained by smearing ashes on body, the ass always rolls in dust.

gurmukhi: jy pweIAY cup kIiqAwN psUAwN jV hwsI
transliteration: Jay Paaeeai Choup Keetiaan Pasooaan Jarh Haasee.
translation: If muteness could bring it, the animals and inert objects are certainly speechless.

gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI gur imlY KlwsI ]14]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovanee Gur Milai Khalaasee ?14?
translation: No liberation is attained without Guru and bondages are shattered only after meeting the Guru.

gurmukhi: 15 mukqI dy Awpxy swDn inSPl
translation: One's own means are of no avail for liberation

gurmukhi: jVIN bUtIN jy jIvIAY ikau mrY DnMqru
transliteration: Jarhee Bootee Jay Jeeveeai Kiu Marai Dhanataru.
translation: If herbal medicines could keep one alive, why did Dhanvantri (the father of Indian system of medicine) die?

gurmukhi: qMqu mMqu bwjIgrwN Eie Bvih idsMqru
transliteration: Tantu Mantu Baajeegaraan Aoi Bhavahi Disantaru.
translation: Conjurers know many tantras and mantras yet they roam about hither and thither in the country.

gurmukhi: ruKIN ibrKIN pweIAY kwst bYsMqru
transliteration: Roukheen Birakheen Paaeeai Kaasat Baisantaru.
translation: If worship of trees could make it available, why should trees themselves get burnt (by their own fire)?

gurmukhi: imlY n vIrwrwDu kir Tg cor n AMqru
transliteration: Milai N Veeraaraadhu Kari Tdag Chor N Antaru.
translation: Adoration of evil and ferocious spirits also does not bring liberation because there is no basic difference between a thief and a cheat.

gurmukhi: imlY n rwqI jwigAwN AprwD BvMqru
transliteration: Milai N Raatee Jaagiaan Aparaadh Bhavantaru.
translation: Liberation cannot be attained through sleepless nights because criminals too remain awake at night wandering here and there.

gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI gurmuiK AmrMqru ]15]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Guramoukhi Amarantaru ?15?
translation: Without Guru no liberation is achieved and the Guru-oriented, gutmulchs become immortal and make others so too.

gurmukhi: 16 nwlwiekwN qoN mukqI AsMBv
translation: Liberation impossible without Guru

gurmukhi: GMtu GVwieAw cUihAwN gil iblI pweIAY
transliteration: Ghantu Gharhaaiaa Choohiaan Gali Bilee Paaeeai.
translation: Rats got a bell made so that it could be hung from the neck of the cat (but it could not materialise).

gurmukhi: mqw mqwieAw mKIAwN iGA AMdir nweIAY
transliteration: Mataa Mataaiaa Makheeaan Ghia Andari Naaeeai.
translation: The flies thought of taking bath in ghee (but all got killed).

gurmukhi: sUqku lhY n kIiVAwN ikau JQu lMGweIAY
transliteration: Sootaku Lahai N Keerhiaan Kiu Jhadu Laghaaeeai.
translation: The defilement of worms and moth never ends then how should they spend their time!

gurmukhi: swvix rihx BMbIrIAwN jy pwir vsweIAY
transliteration: Saavani Rahan Bhanbeereeaan Jay Paari Vasaaeeai.
translation: Insects keep hovering over water surfaces in Silvan (rainy month) howsoever one might try to drive them away.

gurmukhi: kUMjVIAwN vYswK ivic ijau jUh prweIAY
transliteration: Koonjarheeaan Vaisaakh Vichi Jiu Jooh Paraaeeai.
translation: As in the month of Vaisakh migratory heron birds fly over foreign lands.

gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI iPir AweIAY jweIAY ]16]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Dhiri Aaeeai Jaaeeai ?16?
translation: Man without the Guru is not liberated and suffers transmigration.

gurmukhi: 17 kUV dw pwj kUV
translation: The lie is hollow

gurmukhi: jy KuQI ibMfw bhY ikau hoie bjwj
transliteration: Jay Khudee Bindaa Bahai Kiu Hoi Bajaaju.
translation: A cricket sitting on the heap of cloth does not become a draper.

gurmukhi: kuqy dy gil vwsxI n srwPI swju
transliteration: Koutay Gal Vaasanee N Saraadhee Saaju.
translation: If a money belt is tied around the neck of a dog, it does not become a gold merchant.

gurmukhi: rqnmxI gil bwNdrY jauhrI nih kwju
transliteration: Ratanamanee Gali Baandarai Jauharee Nahi Kaaju.
translation: Tying of rubies and jewels around the neck of monkey does not make it behave like a jeweller.

gurmukhi: gdhuN cMdn ldIAY nihN gwNDI gwju
transliteration: Gadahoun Chandan Ladeeai Nahin Gaandhee Gaaju.
translation: Laden with sandalwood, the donkey cannot be called a perfumer.

gurmukhi: jy mKI muih mkVI ikau hovY bwju
transliteration: Jay Moukhee Muhi Makarhee Kiu Hovai Baaju.
translation: If per chance a fly goes into the mouth of a spider, the latter does not become a hawk.

gurmukhi: scu scwvwN kwNFIAY kUiV kUVw pwju ]17]
transliteration: Sachu Sachaavaan Kaanddheeai Koorhi Koorhaa Paaju ?17?
translation: The truth is always true and the falsehood always fake

gurmukhi: 18 AxhoNdw Awp gxwvy so mUrK
translation: Fool is he who though devoid of virtues counts his merits

gurmukhi: 19 AxhoNdw Awp gxwaU gvwr hY
translation: Fool is he who though devoid of virtues counts his merits

gurmukhi: AM|ix puqu gvwNFxI kUVwvw mwxw
transliteration: Anni Poutu Gavaanddhanee Koorhaavaa Maanu.
translation: Pride on account of a neighbour's son who has come to your courtyard is false and vain.

gurmukhi: pwlI cauxw cwrdw Gr ivqu n jwxw
transliteration: Paalee Chaounaa Chaaradaa Ghar Vitu N Jaanu.
translation: A cowherd grazing animals cannot consider them as his property.

gurmukhi: bdrw isir vygwrIAY inrDnu hYrwxw
transliteration: Badaraa Siri Vaygaareeai Niradhanu Hairaanu.
translation: A bonded labourer carrying a bag full of money on his head,

gurmukhi: ijau kir rwKw Kyq ivic nwhI ikrswxw
transliteration: Jiu Kari Raakhaa Khayt Vichi Naahee Kirasaanu.
translation: Would still remain poor and wonderstruck.

gurmukhi: pr Gru jwxY Awpxw mUrKu imhmwxw
transliteration: Par Gharu Jaanai Aapanaa Moorakhu Mihamaanu.
translation: As caretaker of the crop is not its owner, similarly the guest who considers other's house as his own is a stupid one.

gurmukhi: Axhodw Awpu gxwiedw Ehu vfw Ajwxw ]18]
transliteration: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaaindaa Aohu Vadaa Ajaanu ?18?
translation: He is the biggest ignorant fool who having nothing of his own pretends to be master of everything.

gurmukhi: kIVI vwk n QMmIAY hsqI dw Bwru
transliteration: Keerhee Vaak N Danmeeai Hasatee Daa Bhaaru.
translation: An ant cannot bear the weight of an elephant.

gurmukhi: hQ mroVy mKu ikau hovY sIh mwru
transliteration: Had Marorhay Makhu Kiu Hovai Seenh Maaru.
translation: How can a fly turning and twisting its limbs be a killer of lions?

gurmukhi: mCru fMgu n pujeI ibsIAru buirAwru
transliteration: Machharu Dangu N Pujaee Biseearu Buriaaru.
translation: Mosquito's sting can never equate itself with the poison of a serpent.

gurmukhi: icqRy lK mkauiVAwN ikau hoie iskwru
transliteration: Chitray Lakh Makaurhiaan Kiu Hoi Sikaaru.
translation: How can even millions of large black ants hunt a leopard?

gurmukhi: jy jUh sauVI sMjrI rwjw n Bqwru
transliteration: Jay Jooh Saurhee Sanjaree Raajaa N Bhataaru.
translation: Owner of a quilt infected with millions of lice, cannot be called their King or master.

gurmukhi: AxhoNdw Awpu gxwiedw auhu vfw gvwru ]19]
transliteration: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaaindaa Uhu Vadaa Gavaaru ?19?
translation: He who devoid of everything still pretends to have everything is the biggest fool.

gurmukhi: 20 gurU dI prK s`c hY
translation: Truth is the test of a Guru

gurmukhi: puqu jxY viV koTVI bwhir jgu jwxY
transliteration: Poutu Jaanai Varhi Kotdarhee Baahari Jagu Jaanai.
translation: A son is given birth in a closed room but all the people outside come to know of it.

gurmukhi: Dnu DrqI ivic dbIAY msqku prvwxY
transliteration: Dhanu Dharatee Vichi Dabeeai Masataki Paravaanai.
translation: The wealth even buried in the earth is revealed through facial expressions of the owner.

gurmukhi: vwt vtwaU AwKdy vuTY ieMdRwxY
transliteration: Vaat Vataaoo Aakhaday Voutdai Indraanai.
translation: Even an ordinary passerby can tell that it has already rained.

gurmukhi: sBu ko sIsu invwiedw cViHAY cMdRwxY
transliteration: Sabhu Ko Seesu Nivaaidaa Charhhiai Chandraanai.
translation: All bow towards it as the new moon rises.

gurmukhi: gorK dy gil godVI jgunwQu vKwxY
transliteration: Gorakh Day Gali Godarhee Jagu Naadu Vakhaanai.
translation: Gorakh has a patched blanket around his neck but the world knows him as nath, the great master.

gurmukhi: gur prcY guru AwKIAY sic scu is\\\\wxY ]20]
transliteration: Gur Parachai Guru Aakheeai Sachi Sachu Siaanai ?20?
translation: Knowledge of the Guru is called the Guru; only the truth identifies the truth.

gurmukhi: 21 vIh AOgux
translation: I have all the demerits

gurmukhi: hau AprwDI gunhgwru hau bymuK mMdw
transliteration: Hau Aparaadhee Gounahagaar Hau Baymoukh Mandaa.
translation: I am a criminal, a sinner, evil and apostate.

gurmukhi: coru Xwru jUAwir hau pr Gir johMdw
transliteration: Choru Yaaru Jooaari Hau Par Ghari Johandaa.
translation: I am a thief, adulterer; gambler who always keeps his eye upon other's household.

gurmukhi: inMdku dustu hrwmKoru Tgu dys TgMdw
transliteration: Nidaku Dousatu Haraamakhor Tdagu Days Tdagandaa.
translation: I am a slanderer, knave, venal and a swindler who goes on cheating the whole world.

gurmukhi: kwm kRoDu mdu loB mohu AhMkwr krMdw
transliteration: Kaam Krodh Madu Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru Karandaa.
translation: I feel proud of my sexual urges, anger, greed, infatuations and other intoxications.

gurmukhi: ibsvwsGwqI AikrqGn mY ko n rKMdw
transliteration: Bisavaasaghaatee Akirataghan Mai Ko N Rakhandaa.
translation: I am treacherous and ungrateful; none likes to keep me with him. Remember,

gurmukhi: ismir murIdw FwFIAw siqguru bKsMdw ]21]36]
transliteration: Simari Mureedaa Ddhaaddheeaa Satigur Bakhasandaa ?21?36?chhatee?
translation: 0 singing disciple! that the true Guru, alone is competent to grant pardon (for your sins).

gurmukhi: inrgun srgun kY AlK Aibgq giq pUrn bHm gur rUp pRgtwey hY
transliteration: Niragoun Saragoun Kai Alakh Abigat Gati , Pooran Braham Gur Roop Pragataaay Hai ?
translation: The Supreme Lord whose countenance is beyond perception, who is indestructible, despite being formless took human form and revealed Himself as Guru.

gurmukhi: srgun sRI gur drs kY iDAwn rUp Akul Akwl gurisKnu idKwey hY
transliteration: Saragoun Sree Gur Daras Kai Dhiaan Roopa , Akul Akaal Gursikhanu Dikhaaay Hai ?
translation: God in His immanent form as Satguru who is beyond all castes, creed and race make the Sikhs realise the true form of God.

gurmukhi: inrgun sRI gur sbd Anhd Duin sbd byDI gur isKnu sunwey hY
transliteration: Niragoun Sree Gur Sabad Anahad Dhouni , Sabad Baydhee Gur Sikhanu Sounaaay Hai ?
translation: The heart piercing melodious tune which Satguru sings to his Sikhs is in fact manifestation of True Lord.

gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd inhkwm Dwm guruisK mDukr giq lptwey hY ]36]
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarand Nihakaam Dhaama , Gurousikh Madhoukar Gati Lapataaay Hai ?36?
translation: Fragrance of the dust (of the lotus feet of such Satguru) with which the Sikhs remain attached is capable of destroying all worldly desires. (36)
